meanings.definition: The quality or state of being integrable.
meanings.sent1: The integrability of the function allowed for a smooth calculation.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study the integrability of various functions.
meanings.sent3: The integrability of the puzzle made it easy to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her integrability with the team made the project run seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The integrability of the ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious outcome.

meanings.sent1: The integrability of the data into the system was crucial for analysis.
meanings.sent2: Engineers often consider the integrability of new technologies into existing systems.
meanings.sent3: The integrability of the new software caused excitement among the team.
meanings.sent4: The integrability of different perspectives led to a creative solution.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the integrability of concepts is key to grasping complex ideas.
